title: George Strait & Chris Stapleton’s 2025 Stadium Tour: How to Get Last-Minute Tickets
description: Strait and Stapleton will perform in five cities across the country. Learn how to get tickets and everything else you need to know. George Strait & Chris Stapleton’s 2025 Stadium Tour: How to Get Last-Minute Tickets Jo Vito
author: Jo Vito
excerpt: George Strait and Chris Stapleton will play a series of stadium shows together through 2025. Learn how to get last-minute ticket details and everything else to know.
text: Country music icon George Strait and 11-time Grammy winner Chris Stapleton are kicking off their monumental 2025 stadium tour beginning May 10th in Philadelphia. The tour will hit five major venues across the country, offering fans the chance to witness the performers share the stage for a limited number of shows. If you’re looking to grab last-minute tickets to see these country powerhouses, we’ve got you covered with everything you need to know about the tour and how to secure your seats before it’s too late. Get George Strait and Chris Stapleton Tickets Here George Strait and Chris Stapleton’s 2025 Tour Dates 05/10 – Philadelphia, PA @ Lincoln Financial Field * (Get Tickets) 05/31 – Pittsburgh, PA @ Acrisure Stadium * (Get Tickets) 06/14 – Buffalo, NY @ Highmark Stadium * (Get Tickets) 06/21 – Foxborough, MA @ Gillette Stadium * (Get Tickets) 07/19 – Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium # (Get Tickets) * = w/ Parker McCollum # = w/ Little Big Town What to Expect from George Strait and Chris Stapleton’s Upcoming Concerts? After breaking the record for the largest single ticketed concert in US history with 110,905 fans at Texas A&M’s Kyle Field, George Strait is bringing his catalog of country hits to stadiums across America alongside country superstar Chris Stapleton. “I keep trying to slow down a bit but you keep calling me back. Please don’t ever stop. I still love it just as much as I always have,” Strait said in a statement. “Thank you for an amazing year last year and I can’t wait to see you for a few more again this year.” Specifically, the tour will kick off at the Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia on May 10th, followed by stops in Pittsburgh; Buffalo, New York; and Foxborough, Massachusetts; before wrapping with a final performance in Inglewood, California on July 19th. Why StubHub is Your Best Last-Minute Option to Get Tickets While official tickets for these stadium shows went on sale back in February 2025 through George Strait’s website, some dates sold out rapidly due to overwhelming demand. However, fans still hoping to attend these landmark performances can find tickets on the secondary market. StubHub remains your best bet for securing last-minute tickets to any of the tour dates. The trusted resale platform offers a wide selection of seats across all price points, with their FanProtect guarantee ensuring valid tickets and smooth entry on show day—even for purchases made just hours before the event. The StubHub Advantage for Last-Minute Buyers Dynamic Listings: StubHub’s platform updates continuously as new tickets become available Mobile-Optimized Experience: Perfect for on-the-go purchasing decisions Instant Digital Delivery: No waiting for physical tickets to arrive Price Drop Alerts: Notification system to catch when seats hit your target price How Much Are George Strait and Chris Stapleton Tickets? Given the caliber of artists and the limited number of shows, ticket prices on StubHub currently reflect high demand. For most venues, last-minute tickets start around $80 to $200 for upper-level seating, with floor and lower-level sections ranging from $350 to over $1,000 depending on proximity to the stage. Anticipated Setlist Fans attending these massive stadium shows can expect career-spanning setlists from both headliners. George Strait — with his catalog of 60 number-one hits (more than any other artist in history) — will likely perform classics like “Amarillo By Morning,” “All My Ex’s Live In Texas,” and “The Chair,” alongside selections from his latest album, Cowboys and Dreamers. Chris Stapleton, known for his powerful vocals and soulful songcraft, will bring his own impressive repertoire of hits, potentially including “Tennessee Whiskey,” “Starting Over,” and tracks from his acclaimed 2023 album Higher. Who Is Opening for George Strait and Chris Stapleton on Their 2025 Tour? The 2025 stadium shows will feature different special guests depending on the location. Rising country star Parker McCollum will join for the first four dates, while Grammy-winning group Little Big Town will take the stage for the tour’s only West Coast appearance at Inglewood’s SoFi Stadium. In a statement, Strait said he’s “glad to have Little Big Town with us in LA,” and added that McCollum will appear at the remainder of the dates, “which will be outstanding.” Market analysis based on current StubHub data as of May 2025. Prices subject to change based on demand.
html:
Country music icon George Strait and 11-time Grammy winner Chris Stapleton are kicking off their monumental 2025 stadium tour beginning May 10th in Philadelphia.

The tour will hit five major venues across the country, offering fans the chance to witness the performers share the stage for a limited number of shows. If you’re looking to grab last-minute tickets to see these country powerhouses, we’ve got you covered with everything you need to know about the tour and how to secure your seats before it’s too late.

Get George Strait and Chris Stapleton Tickets Here

George Strait and Chris Stapleton’s 2025 Tour Dates

05/10 – Philadelphia, PA @ Lincoln Financial Field * (Get Tickets)
05/31 – Pittsburgh, PA @ Acrisure Stadium * (Get Tickets)
06/14 – Buffalo, NY @ Highmark Stadium * (Get Tickets)
06/21 – Foxborough, MA @ Gillette Stadium * (Get Tickets)
07/19 – Inglewood, CA @ SoFi Stadium # (Get Tickets)

* = w/ Parker McCollum
# = w/ Little Big Town

What to Expect from George Strait and Chris Stapleton’s Upcoming Concerts?

After breaking the record for the largest single ticketed concert in US history with 110,905 fans at Texas A&M’s Kyle Field, George Strait is bringing his catalog of country hits to stadiums across America alongside country superstar Chris Stapleton.

“I keep trying to slow down a bit but you keep calling me back. Please don’t ever stop. I still love it just as much as I always have,” Strait said in a statement. “Thank you for an amazing year last year and I can’t wait to see you for a few more again this year.”

Specifically, the tour will kick off at the Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia on May 10th, followed by stops in Pittsburgh; Buffalo, New York; and Foxborough, Massachusetts; before wrapping with a final performance in Inglewood, California on July 19th.

Why StubHub is Your Best Last-Minute Option to Get Tickets

While official tickets for these stadium shows went on sale back in February 2025 through George Strait’s website, some dates sold out rapidly due to overwhelming demand. However, fans still hoping to attend these landmark performances can find tickets on the secondary market.

StubHub remains your best bet for securing last-minute tickets to any of the tour dates. The trusted resale platform offers a wide selection of seats across all price points, with their FanProtect guarantee ensuring valid tickets and smooth entry on show day—even for purchases made just hours before the event.

The StubHub Advantage for Last-Minute Buyers

Dynamic Listings: StubHub’s platform updates continuously as new tickets become available
Mobile-Optimized Experience: Perfect for on-the-go purchasing decisions
Instant Digital Delivery: No waiting for physical tickets to arrive
Price Drop Alerts: Notification system to catch when seats hit your target price

How Much Are George Strait and Chris Stapleton Tickets?

Given the caliber of artists and the limited number of shows, ticket prices on StubHub currently reflect high demand. For most venues, last-minute tickets start around $80 to $200 for upper-level seating, with floor and lower-level sections ranging from $350 to over $1,000 depending on proximity to the stage.

Anticipated Setlist

Fans attending these massive stadium shows can expect career-spanning setlists from both headliners. George Strait — with his catalog of 60 number-one hits (more than any other artist in history) — will likely perform classics like “Amarillo By Morning,” “All My Ex’s Live In Texas,” and “The Chair,” alongside selections from his latest album, Cowboys and Dreamers.

Chris Stapleton, known for his powerful vocals and soulful songcraft, will bring his own impressive repertoire of hits, potentially including “Tennessee Whiskey,” “Starting Over,” and tracks from his acclaimed 2023 album Higher.

Who Is Opening for George Strait and Chris Stapleton on Their 2025 Tour?

The 2025 stadium shows will feature different special guests depending on the location. Rising country star Parker McCollum will join for the first four dates, while Grammy-winning group Little Big Town will take the stage for the tour’s only West Coast appearance at Inglewood’s SoFi Stadium.

In a statement, Strait said he’s “glad to have Little Big Town with us in LA,” and added that McCollum will appear at the remainder of the dates, “which will be outstanding.”

Market analysis based on current StubHub data as of May 2025. Prices subject to change based on demand.
